Description: Wheel-made pottery lamp with a flattened globular body and an inward-sloping rim defined by a groove, and a long tapering flat-topped nozzle; the horizontal strap handle is missing. Covered with a metallic black glaze. Over this are patches of a resinous black substance. Fine orange fabric.
Curator's comments: Parallel from Athens (Howland 1958, Type 25A, dated 375BC-275BC). Late 4th or 3rd century BC parallel from Alexandria (Blondé 1998, 313-4, no. 1). Bailey dates this piece 350BC-300BC. Blondé, F. 1998. Lampes tournée Hellénistiques du Musée D’Alexandrie, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 307-35. Howland, R.H. 1958. The Athenian Agora, IV, Greek lamps and their survivals. Princeton.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q81)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (253)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.38) (Phase 1)
